clinical_study.brief_title: Remicade® Crohn's Disease Registry Across Canada (Study P02793)
clinical_study.official_title: Remicade® Treatment Registry Across Canada in Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This registry is a multi-center, prospective, observational program that will gather and analyze data on subjects with Crohn's disease being treated with Remicade® as per approved product monograph in Canada. In contrast to a controlled clinical trial, there is no imposed experimental intervention and treatment with Remicade® is determined solely by the subject's physicians. Thus, the data captured and reported in this registry will reflect a "real world" approach to the treatment of Crohn's disease with Remicade®.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will be selected for this registry using a non-probability sampling method.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Satisfied a post-marketing commitment to Canadian Health Authorities.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at 12 Months (Decrease in Crohn's Disease Activity Index [CDAI]>= 70 Points AND >= 25% From Baseline).
primary_outcome.description: CDAI is calculated based on 8 factors: # of liquid stools, abdominal pain, patient well-being, Crohn's complications, need for anti-diarrheal medications, abdominal mass, hematocrit, and weight. CDAI can range from 0 to 600. Remission is < 150, and moderate to severe disease ranges from 220 to 450.

study_pop.textblock: Primarily from community centers and some academic centers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient was given the Patient Information Brochure; AND,
- Patient has never been treated with Remicade® (patient is naïve to Remicade® at the time of registration); AND,
- Patient is a good candidate to receive Remicade® as per the product monograph; AND,
- Patient has agreed to complete the Patient Diary for one week prior to each visit in the registry; AND,
- Patient has signed the approved consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Per product monograph

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was an observational trial/registry. Recruitment began in 2002. Subjects were drawn from community centers and some academic centers.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Not applicable for an observational trial. Subjects were not assigned to treatment, but received infliximab only if their physician had decided to treat with infliximab.
